title: Famous Fashion Designer Paul Costelloe Passes Away
summary: Paul Costelloe, a famous Irish fashion designer, has died at age 80 in London after a short illness. He was surrounded by his family. Paul was born in Dublin and studied fashion in Paris. He started his own fashion label in 1979 and showed his clothes in big cities like London, Paris, Milan, and New York. He was the personal designer for Princess Diana, which made him very well-known. Paul used Irish fabrics like linen and tweed in his designs. He also worked with stores and was part of fashion events. Some people were upset when he said Irish women lacked style, but he later said Ireland had become more European. The Irish Prime Minister said he was sad about Paul's death and called him an icon who brought Irish fashion to the world.
